h:area.p: The Returne of the Cunstables of Brent Pelham
Conserninge the fier hearthes within theare

h:nc.h:e:
First wee Returne one fier hearth which the house
stand emptie and the house and Chemney allmost
Readie to fall downe and that Frances Twinn of the
parish oeth it or former to it 1

And allso wee Returne a nother house that stand
emptie and noe distresse can be had and that William
Perrey of barly oeth the house

h:nc.h:e: I Returne John Wilson being gon to London for 1 written as 'one' fyre hearth & noe distress can be had.1

I Returne Samuell Allice for foure fyre hearths dwelling within the Liberty of Ware who keeps me off by force4

h:nc.p: The Account of those hearthes wheare no
h:nc.h:e: Nathanael Lavinder 1 hearth Broken up And refuseth to pay for the saide hearth
William Marshall 1 Chimney fallen doun
One house emty having 4 hearthes no disstress Can be had. 4
One house emty haveing 2 hearthes no disstress Can be had 2
One house emty having 2 hearthes no disstress Can be had 2
One house was Returned having 3 fire hearthes A poore Blind Man is in Possession which is maintained by weekely Collection from the Parrish no disstress Can be had 3
h:nc.h:total: 13 hearthes where no disstres Can be had

h:nc.h:e: Wee Returne John Whetbrad for one house with too Fier hath in it and the Rent of it is 25 pound A year but standeth Emptey and ther is no destress to bee had 2

h:area.h:e: Dame Elizab. Roydon Returned the number of 24 but one being a privat oven received but for this last half yeere £1 3s
Thomas Roydon Esq returned 8 But 2 being downe and the house gone Received but 6s
Mrs. Prudence Michell paid for herselfe and for Chimneys returned in the name of Mr. Whaley 16
Mr. Bayly returned 15 But Mr. White having altered the house ther is but 12
Samuel Smith Gent Returned 12 but the house being empty & noe distresse we could receive nothing
Jasper Garnet paid for Mr. Lamb 8
Mrs. Rebecca King returned 7 but one being in a smale tenement that is now in the hands of a poore man Received but 6
James Weaver Returned 2 but the house being empty and noe distress could receive nothing
Will. Fox Returned 5 but the house is empty and noe distres
Edward Alice returned 2 but one being downe received but for 1written as 'one'
John Hollgate returned 4 but he was gone before wee had power to demand the money for this last halfe yeere
John Izard returned 3 but gone long since & noe distres
James Joyner returned 1 but is fallen into want & noe distres
Richard ?Laith returned 2 but he left his house after the first halfe yeere John Cox that is now dead his wife gone & noe distres they being poore
Thomas North & Humphre Else 2
John Peak returned one but 1 he being gone to another house long since ther is noe distress
Ralph Freeman returned 2 but it being for Coll. Roydons mill hee hath paid for him 2s
Richard Draper returned 9 but is fallen into poverty and no distres
James Rider junior returned 3 but was gone before we had power by the Act to distrane
Rebecca Pedley returned one but there dwelt a poore man in that house since it is gone and noe distress 1
John Pery returned 3 but is dead in prison his wife takes almes and noe distres
Abraham Boreham returned 1 but falen into want and gone left no distres his wife takes almes
Will. Browne returned 2 but fallen into want noe distres
Francis Doegood returned 2 but is poore & noe distres
Rob. Holland returned 2 but all gone in gard of poverty & noe distres
Will. Brinkley returned 1 but gone long since left no distres
Stephen Pallmer Returned 2 but he being poor and his house standing on ye Lords wast could find noe distres

div.p: A Tru Retorn of thoes harthes that I cold
not gather but halef of barnes thay war
gon and left thar howeses emty at halef
the year and thar was noe destres to be mad

p.h:taxationDate: For the halfe yeare to March 25th 1663 and returned & payd by Constables May 7th 1663

h:ch.h:total: In tottall 203 written as 'two hundred and three' harthes

h:nc.p: and noe destres to be had

h:nc.h:e: These are to Certify that there was 2 written as 'too' Hearths Returned uppon James Fisher which is now in the occupacion of one John Hearne whoe is mayntayned by the Collection of our parish and there is no distresse to be hadd

h:nc.head: The returne of those fire hearthes that wee cann have no distresse
h:nc.h:e: Joseph Aberry his houses stands empty and wee can have no distresse there being 2 fire hearthes 2
Mr. Roese his Tennements stands empty soe that there is no distresse to be had there being 4 fire hearths 4
Dorcas Oakes her house called Kemps hath no body live there and haveing 4 fire hearthes in it and no distresse to be had 4
Samuell Geary haveing the Cottage that was Mr. Lomaxes hath heitherto been without a Tennant haveing nobody live in it soe that there is no distresse to be had there being 2 fire hearths 2
Francis Halsey & the widdow King liveing in the rents of Mr. Francis King are very poore & receive reliefe of the parishe soe that no distresse can be had, there being 4 fire hearths 4

h:ch.h:e: James Newball 1 noe distresse
Edward Field noe distresse 2

h:nc.h:e: James Newbard 1 written as 'one' fyre hearth the house stands Emtey and noe distreess to bee had
Edmond Feild hath 2 written as 'tow' fyre hearth hee A very poore man and there is noe destreess to bee had

div.p: in Returne for three fire hearths,
so it is that now one of them is demolished
and the roome it was in is turned into

h:nc.h:e: Whereas Marmaduke Humfrey was returned for 2 written as 'two' fier hearths he is now fallen into great poverty and want, and I can finde no destresse there
A Tennement of John Besouth Standeth Emtey and not inhabited 1 written as 'one' hearth or Chimney there is noe destreese to be had

The Constabels therof do returne that whearas Barnard Hopkins and John Lasenbey wear retorned to have 2 fier harthes each of them thay ar now falne into so much powertey that thay recefe almes and thear is no destres to be hade

h:ch.h:e: Wheare as John Bunniam, a poore man was Returned For two Fier hath and upon viwe afterward Found but one, wee cannot destraine For but 1 written as 'one'

h:nc.h:e: Whereas Elizabeth Serman widdowe was Returned for 1 written as 'one' Fire hearth, shee is now fallen into poverty and receiveth Releife of the parishe, and there is no Distresse to be had.

Whereas Thomas Robins was formerly Returned for 3 fire hearths in a Tenement in Kensworth aforesaid, which Tenement is now come into the hands of one William Libarty who is a verie poore man, paieng no Taxes to any thinge, the rent per annum being but 18s and wee cann finde no Distresse.

h:e.h:tp: The house whe Wm. Higgby was
